snippet: The Federal Reserve must still determine what to buy and how much to spend, and officials continue to debate the best way to describe when the agency is likely to stop buying.
abstract: Federal Reserve is widely expected to announce that it will continue buying Treasury securities to stimulate growth in 2013, holding to pledge it undertook in September; Fed must still determine which bonds to buy and how much to spend.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve must still determine what to buy and how much to spend, and officials continue to debate the best way to describe when the agency is likely to stop buying.

headline.seo: Fed Likely to Sustain Bond-Buying Program to Stimulate Growth
headline.main: Fed Is Likely to Sustain Its Stimulus Program
headline.print_headline: Fed Is Likely To Sustain Its Stimulus Program
